headline.main: BERLIN WIDENS ANTI-RED FRONT; 13 Nations to Sign Today Pact Seen as Including Aim to Bind Japan to Axis

lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Nov. 24 -- Seven more nations will join the Anti-Comin -tern Pact when that "corridor to the Tri-Partite Axis Treaty" is renewed here tomorrow for another five years, German officials announced today.
abstract: Bulgaria, Rumania and Croatia send delegates to anti-Comintern pact conf, Berlin; Premier de Bardossy and Croatian Foreign Min Lorkovitch arrive

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS

snippet: BERLIN, Nov. 24 -- Seven more nations will join the Anti-Comin -tern Pact when that "corridor to the Tri-Partite Axis Treaty" is renewed here tomorrow for another five years, German officials announced today....

byline.original: By Telephone to THE NEW YORK TIMES
